title: Even if we do find out black holes exist, how will we use that information and progress if there's so little we can do about it? - Quora

response.answer_text: The main thing is that all these exploration,observation work is being going on is to understand our universe, to understand our galaxy which includes different solar systems, planets, stars, nebulae and a supermassive black hole at the centre of our galaxy. From the birth of the star to its living period and then the death of the star all this can be learned from the black hole. How the universe came into existence? Are there any extra dimensions that there are inside the black holes which we could not observe in our surrounding? To understand the black hole we need to study that is beyond our living 3d mind which we have. Black holes holds the key answers about the universe. It has its roles of "creator, preserver and destroyer".
We have proven they do exist. None of them are anywhere near us.What will we do about it? Not much. It is fascinating, but of no practical use so far.
You should change from black to white holes. Black holes have been proven to exist, both in very tiny and super massive sizes. White holes are however just a hypothesis.
For one thing it looks like early galactic evolution is conditioned by their central supermassive black holes. Matter falling in can radiate large amounts of energy.
